page.title: 03 RIPON PARKS
page.content: This covers South,Middle and North Parks farms,which are owned by Ripon Council. Middle and South Parks are rented to tenant farmers, and North Parks to the Ministry of Defence,who relet it as a farm, but use some of the fields for Territorial Army camps. There is a public right of way which starts at Ripon Golf Club passing through all the Parks farms. Ripon Parks was once the hunting park of the Archbishops of York,and Middle Parks farmhouse was the hunting lodge.There is still a room there that used to be the chapel,but it is in a very dilapidated state. The Staveley family were the wardens of the hunting Parks when{Cardinal {Wolsey,}who died in 1530, was Archbishop of York.
